content:
PixelShader Class

In this Article

Provides a managed wrapper around a High Level Shading Language (HLSL) pixel shader.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class PixelShader : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable
  • PixelShader

Remarks

Use the PixelShader class to access pre-compiled HLSL bytecode in a Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) application. You can create a PixelShader from a Pack URI reference or from a Stream.

Set the UriSource property or call the SetStreamSource method to load the shader bytecode.

To create a custom effect, assign the PixelShader to the PixelShader property of a ShaderEffect.

Constructors summary

PixelShader()

Initializes a new instance of the PixelShader class.

Fields summary

ShaderRenderModeProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.ShaderRenderMode* dependency property.
UriSourceProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.UriSource* dependency property.

Properties summary

ShaderRenderMode

Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use hardware or software rendering.
UriSource

Gets or sets a Pack URI reference to HLSL bytecode in the assembly.

Methods summary

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this PixelShader object, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying this object's dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (which may no longer resolve), but not animations or their current values.
CloneCore(Freezable)
CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this PixelShader object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are copied.
CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable)
CreateInstanceCore()
GetAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
SetStreamSource(Stream)

Assigns the Stream to use as the source of HLSL bytecode.

Events summary

InvalidPixelShaderEncountered

Occurs when the render thread cannot process the pixel shader.

Constructors

  • PixelShader()

    Initializes a new instance of the PixelShader class.

    public PixelShader ();

Fields

  • ShaderRenderModeProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.ShaderRenderMode* dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty ShaderRenderModeProperty;
  • UriSourceProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.UriSource* dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty UriSourceProperty;

Properties

  • ShaderRenderMode

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use hardware or software rendering.

    public System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderRenderMode ShaderRenderMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ShaderRenderMode

      A ShaderRenderMode value that indicates whether to force the use of hardware or software rendering for the effect.

    Remarks

    By default, a ShaderEffect renders in hardware when there is a capable hardware accelerator; otherwise, it renders in software. The ShaderRenderMode property alters this behavior, based on its value.

    If set to ShaderRenderMode, and there is no capable hardware available, the entire ShaderEffect is ignored.

    If set to ShaderRenderMode, the ShaderEffect always renders using software rendering.

    If set to ShaderRenderMode, the ShaderEffect has the default behavior.

  • UriSource

    Gets or sets a Pack URI reference to HLSL bytecode in the assembly.

    public Uri UriSource { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      The Pack URI reference to HLSL bytecode in the assembly.

    Remarks

    The Uri is a Pack URI reference to a file inside the assembly.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Pack URI syntax to load a pixel shader named "sepiaShader.fx.ps" from the application's local executable. 

    pack://application:,,,/myEffects;component/sepiaShader.fx.ps

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this PixelShader object, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying this object's dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (which may no longer resolve), but not animations or their current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader Clone ();

    Returns

    • PixelShader

      A modifiable clone of this instance. The returned clone is effectively a deep copy of the current object. The clone's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false.

    Remarks

    The Clone method can be used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects. For convenience, this method shadows the inherited Clone method to provide a strongly typed implementation.

  • CloneCore(Freezable)
    protected override void CloneCore (System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable);

    Parameters

    • sourceFreezable
      Freezable

      To be added.

  • CloneCurrentValue()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this PixelShader object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are copied.

    public System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader CloneCurrentValue ();

    Returns

    • PixelShader

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

  • CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable)

  • SetStreamSource(Stream)

    Assigns the Stream to use as the source of HLSL bytecode.

    Occurs when the render thread cannot process the pixel shader.
